Description: Lip and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup, top of lip lost; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; in handle zone black-figure decoration consisting of head of man with added red on hair and beard to left; in field to left a diagonal line and a thicker vertical, perhaps spear and staff or lagobolon..
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0467) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
